meanings.sent1: The leaf had a sagittate tip, similar to the point of an arrow.
meanings.sent2: The sagittate design of the road sign made it easy to recognize.
meanings.sent3: The sagittate clouds in the sky seemed to point towards the horizon.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit was like a sagittate arrow, hitting the target every time.
meanings.sent5: The sagittate shape of the rock formation stood out against the flat landscape.

meanings.definition: Having a shape resembling an arrowhead.
meanings.sent1: The bird's beak was sagittate, perfect for catching fish.
meanings.sent2: The sagittate petals of the flower gave it a unique appearance.
meanings.sent3: The sagittate shadow cast by the tree looked like a giant arrow on the ground.
meanings.sent4: His sagittate gaze pierced through the crowd, searching for her.
meanings.sent5: The sagittate pattern on the fabric added a touch of elegance to the dress.

meanings.definition: Having a shape like an arrowhead.
meanings.sent1: The sagittate symbol on the map indicated the location of the treasure.
meanings.sent2: The sagittate tip of the spear gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The sagittate formation of the trees created a natural pathway through the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her sagittate remarks always hit the mark, leaving others impressed.
meanings.sent5: The sagittate outline of the mountain peak stood tall against the sky.
